Chapter 01 : Design Domain. Case Scenario.
Designing and Managing a Tech-Driven Coee Shop
Introduction
Imagine stepping into a coee shop where technology enhances every aspect of the experience - from a custom-designed coee machine built by you to digital ordering systems and ecient business management strategies. In this project, you will act as an entrepreneur tasked with designing and managing a coee shop. The government has provided space for a new coee shop, but with a twist: instead of purchasing an existing coee machine, you’ll design and build one yourself. Why? Because designing your own machine allows you to create a device that perfectly suits your shop’s unique needs, incorporates innovative features, and reduces dependency on pre-made, often expensive, machines. This project will integrate business strategy with design, electronics, robotics, and programming to build a functional coee shop model from the ground up.
Mission
Your mission is to create a protable, tech-driven coee shop. You'll integrate business planning with modern technology to ensure operational eciency, excellent customer service, and overall protability.
Scenario Context
Who: Entrepreneurs responsible for managing their own coee shop. What: Develop a business plan and incorporate innovative technology into the shop’s operations. Where: The space provided by the government, with potential expansion to online platforms. When: Simulate the process of launching a coee shop in a competitive market. Why: To understand how to establish a protable and operationally ecient coee shop, utilizing innovative design and technology solutions.
03

Driving Question
How can we create a successful coee shop business using innovative technology, design, and nancial planning to ensure protability and customer satisfaction?
Objectives/Goals
By the end of this project, you will:
1. Use the product development template to dene and document the purpose of a feasibility study for starting a business
2. Utilize Fusion 360 to design essential coee machine components, such as heat distribution systems and water ow mechanisms.
3. Understand circuit design principles for automating water pumps and push-button systems in coee machines. 4. Implement digital inputs/outputs and control logic for automating the water pumps using Arduino. 5. Design functional circuits using Arduino to control water pumps, ensuring they start/stop with appropriate inputs. 6. Understand the dierence between UI (User Interface) and UX (User Experience) design.
7. Explain how UI/UX principles inuence the usability and engagement of a mobile app in a coee shop setting.
8. Use HTML to create the structure of a fully-functional coee shop website, including sections like the homepage, menu, about page, and contact forms.
Your Challenge
By the end of this project, you’ll have:
Developed a complete business plan and feasibility study for a new coee shop, analyzing market opportunities and nancial requirements.
Designed key components of a coee machine using Fusion 360 and created an automated water pump system using Arduino.
Programmed Arduino circuits to control the coee machine’s water ow with push-button functionality.
Created a mobile app or website to manage customer interactions and orders, applying UI/UX design principles for a smooth user experience. Presented your coee shop plan and prototype to a panel, showcasing how your business can successfully operate with a combination of entrepreneurial strategy and technology.
Are you ready to build a coee shop model that could become the next big thing in the food and beverage industry? Let’s get started!
